that ignore but love you.
(punch/bite d4)

starting_equipment.name: Toolbox
starting_equipment.desc: 10 nails, tongs, hammer, small saw and drill.

starting_equipment.name: Shield
starting_equipment.desc: (-1 HP damage or have the shield break to ignore one attack.)

starting_equipment.name: Lard
starting_equipment.desc: (may function as 5 meals in a pinch)

armor.name: Medium
armor.effect: DR+2 on Agility tests including defence

armor.name: Heavy
armor.effect: DR+4 on Agility tests, defence is DR+2

unclean.name: Palms open the southern Gate
unclean.desc: A ball of fire hits d2 creatures dealing d8 damage per creature.

unclean.name: Tongue of Eris
unclean.desc: A creature of your choice is confused for 10 minutes.

unclean.name: Te-Le-Kin-Esis
unclean.desc: Move an object up to D10x10 feet for d6 minutes.

unclean.name: Daemon of Capillaries
unclean.desc: One creature suffocates for d6 rounds, losing d4 HP per round.

unclean.name: Nine Violet Signs Unknot The Storm
unclean.desc: produce d2 lightning bolts dealing d6 damage each.

unclean.name: Metzhuotl Blind your Eye
unclean.desc: A creature becomes invisible for d6 rounds or until it is damaged, attacking/defending with dr6.

unclean.name: Eyelid Blinds the Mind
unclean.desc: d4 creatures fall asleep for one hour unless they succeed a DR14 test.

unclean.name: Death
unclean.desc: all creatures within 30 feet lose a total of 4d10 HP.

sacred.name: Grace of a Dead Saint
sacred.desc: d2 creatures regain d10 HP each.

sacred.name: Grace for a Sinner
sacred.desc: A creature of your choice gets +d6 on one roll (damage, tests, etc.)

sacred.name: Whispers Pass the Gate
sacred.desc: Ask three questions to a deceased creature.

sacred.name: Aegis of Sorrow
sacred.desc: A creature of your choice gains 2d6 extra HP for 10 rounds.

sacred.name: Unmet Fate
sacred.desc: One creature, dead for no more than a week, is awakened with terrible memories.

sacred.name: Bestial Speech
sacred.desc: You may speak with animals for d20 minutes.

sacred.name: False Dawn/Night's Chariot
sacred.desc: Light or pitch black for 3d10 minutes.

sacred.name: Hermetic Step
sacred.desc: You find all traps in your path for 2d10 minutes.

sacred.name: Roskoe's Consuming Glare
sacred.desc: d4 creatures lose d8 HP each.

sacred.name: Enochian Syntax
sacred.desc: One creature blindly obeys a single command.

starting_bonus.name: Crumpled Monster Mask
starting_bonus.desc: Strikes primitive fear into lesser creatures like goblins, gnoums and children. While worn, they check Morale every round.

starting_bonus.name: The Brown Scimitar of Galgenbeck
starting_bonus.effect: DR10 attack and defence while you wield it. 1 in 6 chance a wounded enemy is smitten with potent sepsis, dying in 10 minutes.

starting_bonus.name: Wizard Teeth
starting_bonus.desc: Weird teeth rattle within a blackened pouch. Before battle roll a d6 for each one. For every 6 one of your attacks deals maximum damage.

starting_bonus.name: Ancient Gore-Hound
starting_bonus.desc:
Attacks with DR10 (bite d6). Defends with DR12, 10 HP. Becomes frenzied around goblins and berserkers.
Asthmatic, deluded and on its last legs, this wizened creature still has a superb nose and can sniffle up treasure in the most disgusting debris.

starting_bonus.name: The Shoe of Death’s Horse
starting_bonus.effect: In your hands it hits with DR10. 1 in 6 chance the shoe smashes the skull, instantly killing small-to-medium sized creatures. The shoe returns to your hand like a boomerang.

starting_bonus.name: Coward’s Jab
starting_bonus.desc: When attacking by surprise test Agility DR10. On a success you automatically hit once with a light one-handed weapon, dealing normal damage +3.

starting_bonus.name: Filthy Fingersmith
starting_bonus.desc: Your snaky little digits get into pockets and pick locks with a DR8 Agility test. You also begin with lockpicks!

starting_bonus.name: Abominable Gob Lobber
starting_bonus.desc: Your phlegm is viscous, lumpy, vile and ballistically accurate at short range. You can spit d2 times during a fight. Roll a DR8 Presence test for accuracy. Targets are blinded, retching and vomiting for d4 rounds. Anyone witnessing this—friend and foe—must make a Toughness test to not also vomit. PCs test DR10 and enemies DR12.

starting_bonus.name: Escaping Fate
starting_bonus.desc: Every time you use an omen there is a 50% chance it is not spent.

starting_bonus.name: Excretal Stealth
starting_bonus.desc: You have an astounding, almost preternatural ability to hide in muck, debris and filth. When hidden in these conditions a DR16 Presence test is required to notice you.

starting_bonus.name: Dodging Death
starting_bonus.desc: You are so unpleasant, irrelevant, disgusting and vile even Death would rather avoid you if it can. On death, if there is even the slightest possibility that you survived, there is a 50% chance that you did. If successful, after 10 rounds you pop back up with d4 HP and an unlikely explanation of your escape.
